access.title: How to regain access to an account when the password is lost?
access.descr: To reset your password, you need to click on the "Log In" button, then click on "Forgot Password" and enter your email. After that, you will receive an email. You will need to follow the link in the email and change your password. Then, you can log in to the system with the new password.

email.title: If I don't have access to my email, what should I do?
email.descr: If two-factor authentication is disabled, you can link a new email through your account. You should go to User Settings - Security. When you change your email, a confirmation code and a confirmation link are sent to the user immediately. If the email is not confirmed within 24 hours, the old email value is restored. After confirmation, you will also receive a notification that the email has been changed.
email.subdescr: If two-factor authentication is enabled, you will need to contact support to confirm your identity.

merge.title: How to link Telegram and website accounts?
merge.subtitle: There are 2 ways:
merge.descr: If the user has an account in the Telegram bot, account linking occurs in the personal cabinet on the "Settings" tab. In the "Security" section, click "Link Telegram," go to the link in Telegram, and click "start." After that, the accounts are automatically linked.
merge.subdescr: The user was already registered on the website and decided to switch to the bot. If it's their first time in the bot, the bot offers to answer the question, "Do you already have an account?" If the user answers "Yes," they enter their login and password, log into the account through the bot, and their user ID is linked to it.

changeTelegram.title: How to change the Telegram account?
changeTelegram.descr: To change the Telegram account, you can follow the same steps as the first time: click "Link Telegram" in the profile, then go to the link in the chatbot and click "start."
changeTelegram.subdescr: Or you can authenticate through the bot in a new Telegram account.

iqcryptoRecieve.title: How to send funds to my IQCRYPTO wallet?
iqcryptoRecieve.descrPre: To do this, you need to go to your personal cabinet on the
iqcryptoRecieve.descrLast: website, then go to the "Deposit" tab in the left menu, copy the address, and paste it into the source from which you plan to transfer funds.

iqCryptoSend.title: How to send funds from my IQCRYPTO wallet?
iqCryptoSend.descr: To transfer funds from your IQCRYPTO wallet, you need to go to the "Transfer" tab in the left menu of the page, enter the wallet address to which you will be sending the cryptocurrency. Make sure you have double-checked the address, as cryptocurrency transactions are irreversible. In the "Amount" field, enter the amount of currency you want to transfer and click "Send."

wrongAddress.title: I sent to the wrong address. Can you cancel the transfer?
wrongAddress.descr: Cryptocurrency transactions cannot be canceled. If you have sent funds to the wrong address, they cannot be returned. Before sending funds, make sure the wallet address is correct.

fiat.title: What is fiat currency?
fiat.descr: Fiat currency is traditional money, such as dollars, euros, rubles, and others, issued by governments of countries. In the context of a P2P crypto platform, fiat currency is used for buying or selling cryptocurrencies. When you buy cryptocurrency, you pay with fiat money, and when you sell, you receive payment in fiat currency.

trader.title: Who is a trader?
trader.descr: A participant on the platform actively engaged in buying and selling cryptocurrencies. Traders can act as buyers or sellers.

deal.title: What is a deal?
deal.descr: It is the process where an order to buy or sell cryptocurrency is fulfilled, resulting in the transfer of cryptocurrencies or fiat funds between participants.

orders.title: What are Orders, Asks, Bids?
orders.descr: An order is a user platform's proposal to buy or sell a certain amount of cryptocurrency at a specified price.
orders.ask: Asks are orders to sell cryptocurrencies.
orders.bid: Bids are orders to buy cryptocurrencies..

dealPending.title: How will I know when I have a deal?
dealPending.descr: Notifications for each new deal will be displayed on the website.

maxOrders.title: How many orders can I create?
maxOrders.descr: A trader can have no more than 50 orders (enabled and disabled). Orders must contain different payment method values and cryptocurrencies. For example, you can have one order to buy Bitcoin with payment via Sberbank and another to buy Bitcoin with payment via all Russian banks.

dealCancel.title: How can I cancel a deal?
dealCancel.descr: Sellers can cancel a deal before sending the details. In the subsequent stages, a deal can only be canceled by opening a dispute.
dealCancel.subdescr: Buyers can cancel a deal at all stages except for "Waiting for Coins." At the "Waiting for Coins" stage, a deal can only be canceled through support by opening a dispute.

dispute.title: I paid for the deal and confirmed payment, but the trader is not responding. I opened a dispute. What happens next?
dispute.descr: If the trader does not join the dispute, then after the timer expires, the cryptocurrency will be released to you.
dispute.subdescr: If the trader enters the dispute, support will contact each party and make a decision based on the provided data (either release the cryptocurrency or cancel the deal).

timer.title: The deal was automatically canceled due to the payment stage timer expiring. Is it possible to resume the deal?
timer.descr: If a deal was automatically canceled due to the timer during the "Payment for the deal" stage, the buyer can contact support to resolve the situation.
timer.subtitle: There are two possible scenarios:
timer.sellerDidntApproved: If the buyer paid for the deal, but the seller did not confirm, and the deal was canceled, and the buyer did not participate in a dispute.
timer.buyerDidntNotice: If the buyer paid for the deal but did not notify about the payment, and the deal was automatically closed.

solutions.title: Two possible solutions:
solutions.firstSubtitle: If the seller is willing to resolve the issue:
solutions.dealContinue: The deal will be resumed by support, and the seller will transfer cryptocurrency as per the deal.
solutions.dealMoneyBack: The seller will refund the buyer.
solutions.secondSubtitle: If the seller is uncooperative or unresponsive, in that case:
solutions.blocked: After one day, support will suspend the seller's account. To regain the account, the seller must contact support, return the money to the buyer, and provide evidence of the refund to support.

dispute.title: Dispute
dispute.descr: One of the parties to the transaction has opened a dispute, which will lead either to the closure or to the cancellation of the transaction by support.

autoCancel.title: Automatically Cancelled
autoCancel.descr: The trader did not confirm the transaction and did not cancel it before the timer expired at the Waiting for Details / Sending Details stage.

disputeCancel.title: Cancelled by Dispute
disputeCancel.descr: The seller did not join the buyer's dispute, or through the dispute, the seller refunded the payment to the buyer.

closedByDispute.title: Closed by Dispute
closedByDispute.descr: The buyer did not join the dispute, or through the dispute, the seller released the cryptocurrency to the buyer.

verify.title: What is the difference between a verified account and an unverified one?
verify.descr: An unverified account does not have options for: Quick deals, QPay transactions. Also, a verified user is more trusted.

agentIgnore.title: The deal is open, but the user has stopped responding. What can I do?
agentIgnore.descr: If you do not receive a response from the user, you can cancel the deal yourself using the “Cancel the deal” button in the deal, or after the deal timer expires, the deal will be automatically canceled.

report.title: Something went wrong in the deal, and I filed a complaint against the user. What actions will be taken?
report.descr: When a complaint against a user is received by support, all provided information is checked.

mailNotifyReport.title: I received a letter saying that my account is blocked. What should I do?
mailNotifyReport.descr: Notifications about client blocking are not sent via email or Telegram. It's better to double-check all information through support.

rates.title: What is the commission?
rates.descr: The specific size and order of payment for the right to use the Service are always indicated directly in the Service interface.

platformCommission.title: Why did I receive less cryptocurrency than I paid for?
platformCommission.descr: The reason you may receive less cryptocurrency than expected could be that the amount in fiat currency is displayed in your wallet according to the exchange rate, but you are buying at the trader's rate on the platform. The amount in cryptocurrency is constant, unlike the fiat amount.
platformCommission.subdescr: Suppose you buy 0.01 BTC at a rate of 40,000 USD. You expect to pay 400 dollars for this amount, and after the purchase, your account will show an equivalent of 400 dollars (or 0.01 BTC). However, if the BTC rate falls after your purchase, the amount in fiat currency on your account will be less than 400 dollars. This happens because the value of BTC in fiat currency has changed, although the amount of BTC remains the same.

info.title: Where can I find additional information?
info.descrLast: where we will answer your questions, or join our group on Telegram.
